text: The traffic light problems are a type of mathematical problems involving several distant traffic lights out of phase and a car moving at a constant speed. == Example == Imagine a 1-meter road, with a traffic light in the background that changes from red to green every 10 seconds. If the car travels at 1 meter per second, we can guarantee that unless it starts in second 9 of being green, it will always have to wait less than 10 seconds. == References == Category:Traffic signs
title: Traffic light problem
